member.name: M:Bing.Maps.Map.SetHeading(System.Double)
member.summary:
Sets the directional heading of the map. The heading is represented in geometric degrees with 0 or 360 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, and 270 = West.
Make sure the RotateEnabled is set to true before trying to change the map heading.

member.name: M:Bing.Maps.Map.SetHeading(System.Double,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Sets the directional heading of the map as well as the animation duration. If you do not want the view change to animate, set the animation duration to MapAnimationDuration.None.
Make sure the RotateEnabled is set to true before trying to change the map heading.

member.name: M:Bing.Maps.Map.SetZoomLevelAroundPoint(System.Double,Windows.Foundation.Point,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the zoom level of the map view to the specified value while maintaining the screen position of the given point. You can also specify an animation time for the view change. If you do not want the view change to animate, set the animation duration to MapAnimationDuration.None. If you want to use the default animation time, set the animation duration to MapAnimationDuration.Default.

member.name: M:Bing.Maps.Map.TryLocationsToPixels(Bing.Maps.LocationCollection,System.Collections.Generic.IList<Windows.Foundation.Point>)
member.summary: Returns a bool indicating whether the specified locations were successfully converted to map screen pixels. The pixels are provided for a single world map. If multiple world maps are displayed, the first location in the collection that is closest to the center of the map determines which world map to use. This method will work on locations that are not currently in view and will return values outside of the visible map area in the range (0,0) to (ActualWidth,ActualHeight).

member.name: M:Bing.Maps.Map.TryLocationToPixel(Bing.Maps.Location,Windows.Foundation.Point@)
member.summary: Returns a bool indicating whether the specified location was successfully converted to a map screen pixel. This method will work on locations that are not currently in view and will return values outside of the visible map area in the range (0,0) to (ActualWidth,ActualHeight).

member.name: M:Bing.Maps.Map.TryPixelToLocation(Windows.Foundation.Point,Bing.Maps.Location@)
member.summary: Returns a bool indicating whether the specified point was successfully converted to a location. This method will work on locations that are not currently in view.

member.name: M:Bing.Maps.MapLayer.SetPositionAnchor(Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject,Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Sets the position anchor of a dependency object. This attached property is then used to position the element in a Map or MapLayer that is a child of a Map. The position anchor defaults to 0,0 which means the element will have its top-left position aligned with the Position value. For a round pushpin this should be set to (Width / 2, Height / 2) to center the element over its Position.

member.summary: Gets the location that was used as the end location for the route leg. In most cases, the actual end location is the same as the requested waypoint location. However, if a waypoint is not close to a road, a new location is chosen on the nearest road, which becomes the actual end location.

member.summary: Gets the location that was used as the start location for the route leg. In most cases, the actual start location is the same as the requested waypoint location. member.summary: Gets the geocoding level for each location in the response.

member.summary: Gets the parsed query string used to search for a location match.

member.summary: Defines the calculation method used to geocode a location.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeLocationCalculationMethod.Interpolation
member.summary: Interpolation was used to geocode. Interpolation matches the location to a point along a road.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeLocationCalculationMethod.InterpolationOffset
member.summary: Interpolation with an offset was used to geocode. The location was matched to a point along a road with an additional offset to shift the point to the side of the street.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeLocationCalculationMethod.ParcelCentroid
member.summary: The geocode matched the location to the center of a parcel.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeLocationCalculationMethod.Rooftop
member.summary: Rooftop geocoding was used to geocode. The geocode matched the location to the rooftop of a building.

member.summary: The calculation method is not known.

member.summary: Provides access to a collection of GeocodeLocation objects.

member.summary: Defines the best use for a geocoded location.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeLocationUsageType.Both
member.summary: The geocode location can be displayed on the map and used in a route.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeLocationUsageType.Display
member.summary: Use the geocode location to display the location on the map.

member.summary: Use the geocode location when creating a route to the location.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeLocationUsageType.Unknown
member.summary: The best use type is not known.

member.name: T:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeMatchCode
member.summary: Defines the geocoding level of the location match found by the geocode.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeMatchCode.Ambiguous
member.summary: The match was ambiguous, so the location is one of a set of possible matches. For example, when you query for the street address 128 Main St., the response may return two locations for 128 North Main St. and 128 South Main St. because there is not enough information to determine which option to choose.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeMatchCode.Good
member.summary: There was one good match.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeMatchCode.Unknown
member.summary: The match code is not known.

member.name: F:Bing.Maps.Search.GeocodeMatchCode.UpHierarchy
member.summary: The match was found by a move up the geographic hierarchy. This occurs when a match for the location request was not found, so a less precise result is returned. For example, if a match for the requested address cannot be found, then a match code of UpHierarchy with a postal code may be returned.
